name: 4-methylbenzyl alcohol
Reason: The basic unit, benzene, has a melting point around 5.5 degrees Celsius. The addition of a methyl group (+CH3) typically increases the melting point due to an increase in molecular weight and slightly better packing efficiency; this enhancement is usually in the range of +5 to 10. The presence of a benzyl alcohol functional group (-CH2OH) also significantly increases the melting point due to the ability to form hydrogen bonds; this effect could add +40 to 50 degrees to the melting point. Therefore, the combined effects of these functional groups need to be considered in the prediction. However, it is important to note that the spatial arrangement of functional groups on the aromatic ring can hinder or facilitate packing, which would affect the melting point.
